question: Why Gandhi did start the Dandi March?
option1: To demonstrate against the policies of British empire
explanation: On 12th March 1930, Mahatma Gandhi started a march from Sabarmati Ashram in Ahmadabad to the sea shore at Dandi. So that is exactly what Gandhi decided to do; pick up salt from the seashore at Dandi and start the Civil Disobedience Satyagraha which was a protest against the policies of British empire. The march began on 12th March and ended on 5th April, 1930.
